message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
static void removeDuplicates(List<String> array){
    HashSet<String> hs = new HashSet<>();
    Iterator<String> iterator = array.iterator();
    while(iterator.hasNext()){
        String element = iterator.next();
        if(hs.contains(element)){
            iterator.remove();
        } else {
            hs.add(element);
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this solution, we use an iterator to iterate over the list. We maintain a HashSet to keep track of the elements we have seen so far. If an element is already in the HashSet, it means it is a duplicate and we remove it using the iterator's remove() method. If it is not a duplicate, we add it to the HashSet. This way, we remove all duplicates from the list. As for populating the list faster, using an array is already a good approach. You can also consider using the Arrays.asList() method to convert the array to a list directly.
